DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective propose study determine potential role Ketamine analgesic agent pediatric sickle cell disease patient refractory symptom acute ( VOC ) . Our study design follow : Prospective observational study 20 pediatric sickle cell disease patient refractory pain conventional analgesic regimen see pediatric emergency medicine department . Consenting patient refractory pain meeting inclusion criterion give single intravenous bolus Ketamine set dosage 0.25 milligram per kilogram weight . Participants ' perception pain record use standard pain scoring scale ( FLACC score ) . Physiologic criteria heart rate , blood pressure , blood oxygen saturation , total analgesic pharmacologic requirement adequate analgesia hospitalization , duration hospitalization measure . Observational study group continue get standard care outside single bolus Ketamine . 48 hour follow hospital discharge obtain assess degree pain control general clinical status .
DOC.criteria: Pediatric patient ( > 3 yr < 18yrs ) previous diagnosis sickle cell disease ( include Hgb S Beta Thalassemia + , Hgb S Alpha Thalassemia , Hgb S HPFH ) ) see pediatric emergency room set acute vasoocclusive pain crisis . Patients sequelae indicative complicate disease outside acute VOC : 1 . Acute chest syndrome ( new pulmonary infiltrate hypoxemia ) 2 . Aplastic Episode 3 . Evidence infection 4 . Pregnancy CHF 5 . Fever ( > 38.4 ) 6 . Cholangitis cholecystitis 7 . Hypoxia ( SaO2 < 90 % RA ) , O2 saturation decrease 5 % patient 's baseline 8 . Unstable Vital Signs 9 . Patients receive intravenous pain medicine within 24 hour visit emergency department . 10 . History allergic reaction serious reaction Ketamine . 11 . History significant psychiatric illness 12 . Patients refractory pain receive conventional analgesia regimen per protocol .
